column5: Tried making some harnesses this last winter. One of them  tagged the first fish of the day. Hit hard and gave a good fight. But that sun and lack of wind didn't help as we tried yet one more new spot on Erie.   we got one more on a Rap we picked up from Fisherpete - a nice 27 inch fish. He  was deep hooked (swallowed the rap pretty well whole) so he was a tad camera shy and and wasn't swimming too well by the time we got the third hook out of him, so he came home with us too.   holidays coming soon - fingers crossed for some back to back days on the water. Can't wait
Way to go G ! Got one bigger than the old man's...
LOL- that's par for the course Wayne. The kid's got the touch.
Nice going some hawgs right there.
Nice Rick,looking like a fine dinner coming up !!
Nice. Are you using riggers to get those fish ?

smaller fish was taken on a 5 colour lead core off a planer. 27 incher was off the rigger, 90 back 35 down..  3 color core and dispy were silent yesterday, as were any size spoon, which is unusual for me.
Those fish look the same size Rick. Your just bigger thats all. Fish dosent stand out as well as G,s.  Nice outing fellas.
